Test: coverage

Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

2021-03-21

Source: vignettes/tests/test.Rmd
test.Rmd

See tests in semmcci_notes 

library(testthat)
library(semmcci)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'semmcci'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     print
library(lavaan)
#> This is lavaan 0.6-8
#> lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs.

With Defined Parameters

# Generate Data ------------------------------------------------------------
n <- 1000
x <- rnorm(n = n)
m <- 0.50 * x + rnorm(n = n)
y <- 0.25 * x + 0.50 * m + rnorm(n = n)
data <- data.frame(x, m, y)

# Fit Model in lavaan ------------------------------------------------------
model <- "
  y ~ cp * x + b * m
  m ~ a * x
  ab := a * b
"
fit <- sem(
  data = data,
  model = model,
  fixed.x = FALSE
)

# Monte Carlo --------------------------------------------------------------
mc <- mc(
  fit,
  R = 100L, # use a large value e.g., 20000L for actual research
  alpha = c(0.001, 0.01, 0.05)
)
semmcci::print(mc)
#> Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals
#>         est     se   R ci_0.05 ci_0.5 ci_2.5 ci_97.5 ci_99.5 ci_99.95
#> cp   0.2571 0.0345 100  0.1711 0.1749 0.1881  0.3243  0.3513   0.3645
#> b    0.4891 0.0296 100  0.4027 0.4176 0.4348  0.5362  0.5562   0.5655
#> a    0.4835 0.0309 100  0.4067 0.4129 0.4256  0.5423  0.5481   0.5500
#> y~~y 0.9501 0.0414 100  0.8480 0.8545 0.8627  1.0157  1.0227   1.0264
#> m~~m 0.9271 0.0401 100  0.8163 0.8197 0.8428  0.9934  1.0171   1.0226
#> x~~x 0.8944 0.0425 100  0.8059 0.8064 0.8228  0.9840  1.0144   1.0330
#> ab   0.2365 0.0204 100  0.1940 0.1951 0.1991  0.2798  0.2836   0.2846

# Standardized Monte Carlo -------------------------------------------------
std <- std(mc)
semmcci::print(std)
#> Standardized Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals
#>         est     se   R ci_0.05 ci_0.5 ci_2.5 ci_97.5 ci_99.5 ci_99.95
#> cp   0.2063 0.0277 100  0.1372 0.1403 0.1509  0.2602  0.2818   0.2924
#> b    0.4422 0.0267 100  0.3641 0.3776 0.3932  0.4849  0.5029   0.5113
#> a    0.4290 0.0274 100  0.3608 0.3664 0.3776  0.4812  0.4863   0.4880
#> y~~y 0.6836 0.0298 100  0.6101 0.6149 0.6207  0.7308  0.7359   0.7386
#> m~~m 0.8160 0.0353 100  0.7185 0.7214 0.7417  0.8743  0.8952   0.9000
#> x~~x 1.0000 0.0475 100  0.9010 0.9017 0.9199  1.1002  1.1342   1.1550
#> ab   0.1897 0.0164 100  0.1557 0.1565 0.1597  0.2245  0.2275   0.2283

Without Defined Parameters

# Fit Model in lavaan ------------------------------------------------------
model <- "
  y ~ cp * x + b * m
  m ~ a * x
"
fit <- sem(
  data = data,
  model = model
)

# Monte Carlo --------------------------------------------------------------
mc <- mc(
  fit,
  R = 100L, # use a large value e.g., 20000L for actual research
  alpha = c(0.001, 0.01, 0.05)
)
semmcci::print(mc)
#> Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals
#>         est     se   R ci_0.05 ci_0.5 ci_2.5 ci_97.5 ci_99.5 ci_99.95
#> cp   0.2571 0.0333 100  0.1773 0.1794 0.1859  0.3161  0.3351   0.3487
#> b    0.4891 0.0302 100  0.4175 0.4183 0.4326  0.5483  0.5572   0.5625
#> a    0.4835 0.0311 100  0.4210 0.4232 0.4309  0.5525  0.5689   0.5763
#> y~~y 0.9501 0.0398 100  0.8395 0.8424 0.8613  1.0202  1.0325   1.0373
#> m~~m 0.9271 0.0416 100  0.8304 0.8322 0.8545  1.0043  1.0205   1.0247
#> x~~x 0.8944     NA  NA      NA     NA     NA      NA      NA       NA

# Standardized Monte Carlo -------------------------------------------------
std <- std(mc)
semmcci::print(std)
#> Standardized Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals
#>         est     se   R ci_0.05 ci_0.5 ci_2.5 ci_97.5 ci_99.5 ci_99.95
#> cp   0.2063 0.0267 100  0.1422 0.1440 0.1492  0.2536  0.2688   0.2797
#> b    0.4422 0.0273 100  0.3775 0.3782 0.3912  0.4958  0.5038   0.5086
#> a    0.4290 0.0276 100  0.3736 0.3755 0.3823  0.4902  0.5047   0.5113
#> y~~y 0.6836 0.0287 100  0.6041 0.6061 0.6197  0.7341  0.7429   0.7464
#> m~~m 0.8160 0.0366 100  0.7308 0.7324 0.7521  0.8839  0.8981   0.9019
#> x~~x 1.0000     NA  NA      NA     NA     NA      NA      NA       NA
test_that("TRUE", {
  expect_true(
    TRUE
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ¥³
